channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: For half a century, Joan Didion, who died on Thursday, was the grand diagnostician of American disorder in essays of strong, unmistakable cadence. She wrote her first story at age 5, after her mother told her to stop whining and to write down her thoughts.https://t.co/2vf0igpboO
Holiday travel is happening, despite Omicron. If you want to travel responsibly, here are some strategies you can follow. https://t.co/WA0K0KeKhC https://t.co/gdpX98yRbb

Breaking News: Joan Didion has died at age 87. Her sharp dispatches on California and tough, terse novels forged a distinct new voice in American writing. https://t.co/Y7Yiv18CS9 https://t.co/flsrs0cChn

The authorities in Hong Kong removed a statue, known as the “Pillar of Shame,” that memorialized those killed in the 1989 Tiananmen massacre. The removal of the statue, a symbol of the territory’s pro-democracy movement, is the latest crackdown on dissent. https://t.co/m1mOh3Ijfa

“I’ve been targeted by public security,” Li Tiantian, an outspoken teacher in rural China, told a friend in a text message before she disappeared.
Chinese social media has echoed for days with a question: Where is Li Tiantian? https://t.co/v6Gvz7KCzi
Active, physically fit men and women are more than twice as likely to be moderate or heavy drinkers as people who are out of shape, a new study found. https://t.co/xkoLk7IZ4Y

The House committee investigating the Capitol attack wants to interview Rep. Jim Jordan, a Republican congressman from Ohio. Jordan was deeply involved in Donald Trump's effort to fight the 2020 election results. https://t.co/2CRwOgMFOj

We interviewed Carrie-Anne Moss, who played Trinity in "The Matrix," about returning to the role years later for the new sequel: "It was important to me that I let go of any construct in my mind that I needed to look like I did when I was 30." https://t.co/ysMTZKSa73
See 2021 in pictures. https://t.co/UTwdIYtBLC https://t.co/PbQL45ElOM

Tens of millions of Americans will be eligible for Pfizer's Covid pill if they get infected with the virus, though the federal government's supply will be limited at first. Pfizer’s studies indicate that it is likely to work against the Omicron variant. https://t.co/ojlatInkY9 https://t.co/MZ0dUsPxcN

Breaking News: Omicron cases seem less severe compared with previous variants, two studies suggest. But experts warned that hospitals could still be flooded because the variant is so transmissible. https://t.co/cqtd25KV1j

Under Democratic pressure, the White House extended a pause on student loan payments by 90 days. President Biden has resisted delivering on a campaign promise to wipe $10,000 per person and been reluctant to use executive action on sweeping forgiveness. https://t.co/jub3ae4P6c https://t.co/0OL2zl5gNY

The FBI set up extensive surveillance operations inside Portland’s racial justice protest movement, a New York Times investigation found. Agents stood shoulder to shoulder with activists, guiding the police toward arrests and recording clandestine video. https://t.co/nO84DCtLgZ

Breaking News: The Biden administration has extended the pause on student loan payments to May 1. They had been set to resume in February after being effectively frozen for nearly two years during the pandemic. https://t.co/RfX3TJv0BQ

Breaking News: The FDA has cleared Pfizer’s Covid pill, the first of its kind, for high-risk people 12 and over. It was found to protect against severe illness after infection. https://t.co/1JQ3XHSKD8

Breaking News: In a White House address on Tuesday, President Biden tried to calm fears of lockdowns, outlined his Omicron plan and urged more people to get vaccinated. "This is not March of 2020," he said. https://t.co/HT7l4Fg3Jd

A California man who pleaded guilty to threatening dozens of people, including members of Congress and journalists, for saying that Donald Trump had lost the 2020 election was sentenced on Monday to three years in prison. https://t.co/3yg9Gkdl10

A billionaire from Utah, Jeff Green, said he was resigning from the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in an unusually high-profile rebuke of the church’s wealth and position on social issues such as LGBTQ rights and racial equality. https://t.co/0BrZbZLpsO

Gabriel Boric rose to prominence in Chile ten years ago as a student leading rallies for free quality public education. After winning the presidency on Sunday, he is poised to oversee what may be the country's biggest overhaul in decades. https://t.co/m9N0Y5qxeI

A billionaire from Utah, Jeff Green, said he was resigning from the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in an unusually high-profile rebuke of the church’s wealth and position on social issues such as LGBTQ rights and racial equality. https://t.co/ubQtIvts7F
It's still too early to know exactly how, or if, symptoms of Omicron differ from Delta, experts say. Here's what we know so far. https://t.co/GNJBhfySeY https://t.co/5JckhDKZd2

Gabriel Boric was elected president of Chile on Sunday, making the 35-year-old leftist lawmaker the country's youngest leader. He'll take office as Chile, roiled by social upheaval, completes the drafting a new Constitution. https://t.co/ZRS6QPR6Bx

A box full of $50 and $100 bills, totaling $180,000, was sent to the physics department at City College of New York. An enclosed note from the mysterious donor asked the school to use the cash to fund scholarships for needy students. https://t.co/LwFKlKLJz7 https://t.co/laBQFOU07u

About 1,400 striking Kellogg workers have ratified a new contract, their union said Tuesday, ending a strike that began in early October and affected four of the company’s U.S. cereal plants. https://t.co/Z6UQaZTC3q
Breaking News: President Biden is set to unveil new steps to fight Omicron, including deploying federal vaccinators and giving out millions of free rapid tests. https://t.co/s4jh80tjSo

“Nobody can do it for a dollar a slice anymore.”
As food prices rise at their fastest pace in decades, New York City’s dollar-slice pizza businesses are facing an existential crisis. https://t.co/G5ZQLXLG3q https://t.co/Jp5TrMb0uD

A box full of $50 and $100 bills, totaling $180,000, was sent to the physics department at City College of New York. An enclosed note from the mysterious donor asked the school to use the cash to fund scholarships for needy students. https://t.co/nrGF0GLiyk

At least 132 employees at SpaceX’s Southern California headquarters tested positive for Covid, according to information posted on a Los Angeles County website. It was the highest number of cases currently reported among private companies in the county. https://t.co/vtwQPxIBbc

Ethiopia’s prime minister has credited recent battlefield gains to his "heroic" troops. In reality, the reason for the gains was hovering in the skies above: a fleet of combat drones, recently acquired from allies in the Persian Gulf region. https://t.co/4jUynjV9Py

The Pentagon on Monday issued new guidelines meant to root out extremism in the U.S. military, warning that "liking" white nationalist and extremist content on social media and similar activities could result in disciplinary action. https://t.co/RQIwPKRT2e
Breaking News: The N.H.L. will pause its season, postponing all games until next week due to Covid, the first North American league to do so as Omicron rises. https://t.co/rRhFQZwAX3

"It was the most humiliating experience of my life." Haitian migrants pursued by Border Patrol agents on horseback in September have filed a lawsuit accusing the U.S. government of physical and verbal abuse, inhumane treatment and denial of due process. https://t.co/WORzF6s6jX

Fox Corporation, the owner of Fox News, told employees in New York City they will have to show proof that they had at least one dose of a Covid vaccine by Dec. 27, removing a weekly testing option. The policy was in keeping with the city's vaccine rule. https://t.co/d8hlmlOJR3

Pope Francis said that there was something "almost satanic" about the high number of women who had been victims of domestic violence. He has repeatedly called on society to protect vulnerable women at risk. https://t.co/quVwbePTi6
The Jan. 6 panel is examining whether there is enough evidence to recommend criminal referrals against Donald Trump and some of his aides. https://t.co/syUU9BEuJG

Donald Trump was booed at an event in Houston after saying publicly for the first time that he had received a booster shot. He falsely claimed vaccines were dangerous for years and declined to be seen getting vaccinated against Covid-19 while in office. https://t.co/1AjWfGl8cf

Feminist groups spent years defying the law in Mexico, helping thousands of women get abortions. Now that abortions are legal in Mexico, these activists are bringing their mission to the U.S. https://t.co/f9caIzU7Lp
Tech executives and engineers are quitting Google, Meta, Amazon and other large companies for what they say is a once-in-generation opportunity with crypto. https://t.co/apksOZ5sJG

Airstrikes allowed America to wage war with minimal risk to its troops. But for civilians on the ground, they brought terror and tragedy. Read Part 2 of the Civilian Casualty Files in @NYTMag. https://t.co/fzB6h3TqwQ https://t.co/KuMjqBrchc

"I will be a president who cares for democracy and does not risk it," Gabriel Boric said after he was elected to be the youngest president in Chile's history. The 35-year-old is the most liberal since President Salvador Allende in the early 70s. https://t.co/DEW4g8aNab https://t.co/bijxRztHoZ
A New York Times investigation examines how Britney Spears’s business manager, Louise Taylor, profited from the conservatorship that Spears regarded as captivity. https://t.co/JzEfAqP0yn
Breaking News: Donald Trump sued the New York State attorney general, Letitia James, seeking to halt her long-running investigation into his business practices. https://t.co/mnlub740TR

Richard Rogers, the Pritzker Prize-winning architect of the landmark Pompidou Center, whose inviting, colorful modernism forever altered the cityscapes of Paris and London, died on Saturday. He was 88. https://t.co/pnhJos16Dm

Moderna said lab tests of its booster vaccine show it significantly raises the level of antibodies that can thwart the Omicron variant. The news comes as the variant rapidly advances across the world. https://t.co/YsUj66G2kT https://t.co/aojwGlcqh3

For a certain subset of Millennial women, the “Lord of the Rings” film trilogy — with tender male relationships and fearless female characters — has become a treasured part of the comfort-watch genre. https://t.co/5Z0meGRCg5

Breaking News: Senator Joe Manchin, Democrat of West Virginia, said that he could not support President Biden’s social policy bill, all but dooming Democrats' drive to pass it as written. https://t.co/pqytIYt9nj
Breaking News: Moderna said lab tests of its booster vaccine show it significantly raises the level of antibodies that can thwart the Omicron variant. https://t.co/Vj8LAY93YC

A 5-year New York Times investigation into hidden Pentagon records shows that a pattern of errors in U.S. airstrikes in the Middle East has killed thousands of civilians, many of them children. None of these killings resulted in a finding of wrongdoing. https://t.co/EtYzxLos3f

Omicron couldn’t stop Spidey. “Spider-Man: No Way Home" had the highest opening-weekend box office of any of the franchise's live-action films and the third-highest ever for an opening weekend, making an estimated $253 million in the U.S. and Canada. https://t.co/irOh3TiWU2

“This virus is extraordinary,” Dr. Anthony Fauci said on Sunday in reference to the Omicron variant. As Americans wrestle with whether to curtail holiday plans, Fauci said that vaccines, boosters and masks in congregate settings should protect most people. https://t.co/IEFgiEN6Ls
